definition: The mark existed before the survey was conducted and was adopted from a previous survey, i.e., It was not surveyed for this survey.
The mark was created by this survey.
The mark existed before the survey was conducted. The mark is undisturbed and considered to be original. The mark was surveyed as part of this survey.
The mark has been disturbed, hence a new coordinated position.
The mark replaces an existing mark.
